options: A type of chain link fence
A decentralized, distributed ledger that records transactions across many computers
questions.explanation: Blockchain is a distributed database that maintains a continuously growing list of records (blocks) linked cryptographically. Each block contains transaction data, timestamp, and link to previous block. It's decentralized (no single authority), transparent, and virtually tamper-proof. Bitcoin runs on blockchain, but blockchain has many other uses.

options: Financial services using blockchain/crypto without traditional intermediaries like banks
questions.explanation: DeFi provides financial services (lending, borrowing, trading, earning interest) using smart contracts on blockchain, eliminating intermediaries. Benefits: 24/7 access, lower fees, no gatekeepers. Risks: smart contract bugs, volatility, less regulation. Examples: Aave, Uniswap, Compound.

options: Software that stores private keys allowing you to access and manage your cryptocurrency
questions.explanation: A crypto wallet stores private keys (like passwords) that prove ownership of your crypto. Hot wallets (online) are convenient but less secure. Cold wallets (offline hardware) are more secure. Remember: 'Not your keys, not your crypto' - keeping coins on exchanges means you don't truly own them.

options: Unique digital assets verified on blockchain - can represent art, music, virtual land, collectibles
questions.explanation: NFTs are unique digital tokens on blockchain that prove ownership and authenticity of specific digital (or physical) items. Unlike Bitcoin (fungible - one equals another), each NFT is unique. Uses: digital art, music rights, virtual real estate, gaming items, event tickets, membership passes.

questions.text: What is the key security rule for cryptocurrency?
options: Share your private keys with everyone
Never share your private keys or seed phrase with anyone - they give complete access to your funds
questions.explanation: Your private key/seed phrase is like the master key to your bank vault. If someone gets it, they own your crypto - transactions are irreversible. Never: (1) Share it with anyone (no legitimate service asks), (2) Store it digitally, (3) Take photos of it. Write it down, store securely offline. Crypto transfers are permanent.
